items.sentence: Tom told Mary not to worry about what might happen on Monday.
Tom wants to be able to play the fiddle as well as Mary does.
Tom was eating pizza at a restaurant when the fire broke out.
Lower your voice, Tom. You never know who could be listening.
I wasn\'t surprised when Tom told me about what had happened.
I wasn\'t surprised when Tom told me he wanted me to do that.
I wonder whether or not Tom has told Mary she should do that.
My thirteen-year-old son is going on his first date tomorrow.
Tom speaks French better than any other person in our office.
Would you like to volunteer to help clean up after the party?
You might get injured if you do that the way Tom told you to.
The airplane crashed about three kilometers from the airport.
I\'ve already told Tom about the problems we\'ve been having.
I was surprised when I heard Tom and Mary had gotten married.
Tom can\'t do the job by himself. Would you mind helping him?
Tom certainly couldn\'t have thought up this plan by himself.
I think that it\'s unlikely Tom will come to the party alone.
Though Tom and Mary are twins, they don\'t look very similar.
I wonder whether or not Tom knew that Mary couldn\'t do that.
Tom called Mary and found out she wasn\'t planning on coming.
